intro: Alyxia oliviformis f. angusta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf alyxia, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves that are typically dark green and have a glossy appearance. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening in suitable climates.
